intro: Clibadium manabiense, commonly known as the Manabi sumpweed, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a cluster, and its leaves are typically alternate and lance-shaped. It thrives in sandy or coastal soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
